title: Cops ‘open fire’ on speeding truck

organizations.name: twitter/@alfcongostrina emma lake the sun share on twitter  barcelona

text:
Barcelona police shoot at driver of speeding truck loaded with gas cylinders: report February 21, 2017 11:27pm Barcelona cops reportedly shot at the driver of a truck loaded with gas cylinders, hurtling towards the city centre. Picture: Twitter/@alfcongostrina Emma Lake The Sun Share on Twitter 
BARCELONA cops have shot at the driver of a truck reportedly packed with gas cylinders and speeding towards the city centre. 
The butane carrying truck reportedly rammed several cars as it sped towards the Spanish city on Tuesday local time, The Sun reports. 
The driver, whose motivations are unknown, has reportedly been arrested. A passer-by is reported to have been injured by a butane bottle falling from the truck, reports La Vanguardia . Camión de butano en contra dirección en #RondaLitoral #Barcelona ? pic.twitter.com/bQlJE1mmZy — Antonio Lirio (@uklanor) February 21, 2017 Detenido a tiros un camión de butano que ha embestido varios coches en Barcelona https://t.co/JfMrhzSmFM — gemma esteve (@gemaesteve) February 21, 2017 
Local media El Periodico reported that the truck was stolen from a shipyard and driven the wrong way down a road, ramming several vehicles before it was pulled over by police. 
Details of the shooting on a busy route into the city are being shared by local journalists through social media. 
La Vanguardia reports an officer shot at the vehicle’s rear window, causing it to stop. 
On Twitter, journalist Juan Antonio Tirado said: “A detainee for stealing a butane truck and driving against the Barcelona round.” balazos en parabrisas cargado d butano q ha sido interceptado por la @barcelona_GUB iba a entrar en contra dirección en Rda litoral #bcn pic.twitter.com/IJ1ljTxrom — Alfonso Congostrina (@alfcongostrina) February 21, 2017 
El Espanol reported that the driver is Swedish and said police believe he may be suffering from mental health problems. 
La Vanguardia cites sources who claim the driver could have acted under the influence of “psychotropic drugs”. 
Several local news outlets report that the man arrested is 33-year-old Joakim Robin Berggren, a Swedish citizen. Un camión se lleva bombonas del vehículo interceptado por @barcelona_GUB cuando entraba en Rda litoral #Barcelona pic.twitter.com/gV0zDKGEgz — Alfonso Congostrina (@alfcongostrina) February 21, 2017 
Pictures from the scene show a stationary truck loaded with gas cylinders at the side of a road surrounded by police. 
Some media outlets have reported that the driver was killed, but police have said this is not the case. 
This story originally appeared in The Sun and has been republished here with permission.
